messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Uh, 8011 Hollyway Drive.
What's wrong? Are you there?
There's a guy here with a gun.
Can you confirm the address? Hollyway Drive isn't showing 8011.
It's 2601 Holloway Drive, between Holloway and Plant Side.
Got it. What's happening there?
There's a guy with a gun. He's wearing black and white plaid pants and a white shirt or black t-shirt.
Is he inside the building?
No, he's walking around in the parking lot.
What business is this?
Linden Millwork. I ran into their shop across the street.
Did he do anything or just walking around with a gun?
He was looking for someone and pulled a gun from his pocket.
Is he a black male, white male, Hispanic?
He's a white guy, maybe in his early 20s.
All right, let me get someone started out there. Hang on.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
2360 Ampire Drive. There's a man on the property with a gun.
And that's where the person is?
Yes, he's looking for a girl he had trouble with.
What's the name of the business?
Linden Millwork.
Can you provide a description of him?
He's 5'5" or 5'6" with a crew cut, wearing a black shirt and plaid shorts.
We've got officers on the way. Anything else you can tell me?
He's kind of a round-face fellow carrying a gun.
All right, we'll get someone out there. What's your name?
Bob Capitello, I own the business.
Okay, stay on the line. We'll get help to you.
He just shot somebody!
Did anyone get hit?
I don't think so. He fired but missed.
All right, they're on their way. Stay safe and keep down.
He's now inside the building!
We'll get officers there as fast as we can. Where inside is he?
In the main office at the front of the building.
Got it. Officers are close. Stay on the line with me.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I'm at 2360 Ampire Drive. The shooter is my cousin's ex-boyfriend.
What is your name?
Brian McDonald.
Okay, Brian. Officers are en route. Can you stay on the phone and keep safe?
Okay, he's wearing a black shirt and blue plaid shorts. He's in the office.
Got it. Can you get to a safe place?
I'm outside, not going back in.
Stay where you are. Officers are arriving.
I see them, they're here. Thank you.
